column4: There's a way to download some package avoiding the use of Synaptic Package Manager?
what irc client are you using?
xchat from ubuntu 6.10
you should have another tab at the bottom that says "ubotu".  If you click on it, you can read the information ubotu sent you about APT.  See it?
yes

I've used Synaptic Package Manager to install my package and it work well. But now the network administrator set passwords in the proxy for each user and the Synaptic Package Manager failed to download the package. Do you know why happen that?
did you go to system > preferences > network proxy and set up the proxy including your password?
and synaptic also has proxy settings in it's edit menu:  preferences > network
I've configured the network proxy in System/Preference/Network proxy but anyway I can't download any package
right, how about in synaptic's network settings?
I've tried there but I don't see the option to set the user and password
ok, I'm not on edgy atm... butunder the Network tab, there is no "authentication" button?
no
!aptproxy | robe_
I've tried in the form "http://user:password@server:port" but it doesn't work
OK, I'll see it right now!
sorry, I thought that was simpler... see this post: http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/debian-linux-help/55599-configuring-proxy-synaptic-package-manager-ubuntu.html
Ok, thanx
That doesn't work :-(
I'm downloading the package through "apt-get install"
exporting the variable "http_proxy" ;-)
